p:
A complete Holocene sediment record was recovered from Boswell Lake (Fig. 1), a carbonate lake located in British Columbia, Canada (52°32′24.72″N 121°27′5.23″W). Boswell Lake is situated in the Cariboo region of the interior of British Columbia and neighbours Quesnel Lake, the third deepest lake in North America
31 . The site was selected because Botryococcus had previously been morphologically identified throughout the sediment record at Boswell Lake, predominantly from 8,400 cal yrs BP. While pristine environments are arguably rare on Earth
32 , Boswell Lake is extremely remote with minimal human influence on the lake or sediments, making it an ideal site for aDNA analysis.
